params.name: subjectsAssignments
params.doc: An array of new team members' email addresses and their corresponding new assignments to be assigned to it when their invite is accepted.

docs.summary:
Create and send an invite to an array of potential users via email to become team members on this account.
The invite may be limited to a specific resource.
The caller identity must have sufficient permissions to send invites to the account and to any additional site
contexts.
Maximum amount of new users per invite is 50.

members.name: expirationDate
members.doc: Invite expiration date

members.name: status
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'Declined'`
- `'Deleted'`
- `'Expired'`
- `'Pending'`
- `'Used'`

description: Account resource contexts. It indicates that the resource is under the account (can be the account itself or some asset of an account, like a logo or a domain)

members.name: conditionModelId
members.doc: The unique identifier of the condition model. Indicates which actions the condition is working on

members.name: operator
members.doc: The operator that should be evaluated

members.name: dependOn
members.doc: Operator that indicates a dependency on another subject being allowed to perform something.

members.name: equals
members.doc: Comparison of equality - will be evaluated to true if the given parties are equal

members.name: experiment
members.doc: Petri experiment - will be evaluated using petri.

members.name: like
members.doc: Regex operator - will be evaluated to true if the given value matches the provided regex

members.doc: A single condition

members.name: joinedConditions
members.doc: A logic combination between several conditions, with an operator between them

members.name: attrName
members.doc: an attribute. We'll first retrieve the value of the attribute (from the request or from pre-indexed values), and then compare to what it needs to be compared with.

members.name: boolValue
members.doc: a value with a boolean type. Will be compared to the attribute provided, and be true only if they match the operator.

members.name: stringValue
members.doc: a value with a string type. Will be compared to the attribute provided, and be true only if they match the operator.

members.name: attrName
members.doc: an attribute. We'll first retrieve the value of the attribute (from the request or from pre-indexed values), and then compare to what it needs to be compared with.

members.name: boolValue
members.doc: a value with a boolean type. Will be compared to the attribute provided, and be true only if they match the operator.

members.name: stringValue
members.doc: a value with a string type. Will be compared to the attribute provided, and be true only if they match the operator.

members.name: defaultEmailLanguage
members.doc: The language of emails that will be used only for recipients that don't have a user, in case this parameter is unspecified, the sender's language will be used instead

members.name: defaultEmailLanguage
members.doc: The language of emails that will be used only for recipients that don't have a user, in case this parameter is unspecified, the sender's language will be used instead

members.name: subjectsAssignments
members.doc: An array of new team members' email addresses and their corresponding new assignments to be assigned to it when their invite is accepted.

members.name: dependOnSubject
members.doc: The subject on which the current entry depends on. If the subject is allowed to perform what the query was about - the condition will be evaluated to true. Otherwise - false

description: Implies that the policy takes affect only if the depend on subject is permitted as well.

members.name: attrName
members.doc: The attribute which should be compared. The attribute will be first evaluated to a value, and then compared the other side (attribute/value)

members.name: value
members.doc: The value to compare to. If the two parties are equal - we will return true.

members.name: expectedValue
members.doc: The expected value of the experiment conduction. If it matches the actual value - true will be returned. Otherwise - false.

members.name: fallbackValue
members.doc: The value to use if the experiment could not be conducted

members.name: spec
members.doc: The spec to conduct the experiment on.

members.name: accountContext
members.doc: A specific account

members.name: organizationContext
members.doc: A specific organization

members.name: resource
members.doc: A specific resource. We will determine the resource type based on the action.

members.name: siteContext
members.doc: A specific site (we will retrieve the account that the site belongs to)

members.name: accountContext
members.doc: A specific account

members.name: organizationContext
members.doc: A specific organization

members.name: siteContext
members.doc: A specific site (we will retrieve the account that the site belongs to)

members.name: condition
members.doc: A condition that will be applied on the assignment

members.name: fullNameResource
members.doc: The resource of the invite assignment

members.name: conditions
members.doc: The conditions that should be evaluated, and then joined using the operator provided

members.name: op
members.doc: The operator that should be used when evaluating the condition

members.name: attrName
members.doc: The attribute which should be compared. The attribute will be first evaluated to a value, and then compared the regex values provided.

members.name: values
members.doc: The regex values which the attribute value should be evaluated on. If the attribute value matches at least one of the regular expressions provided - we will return true

members.name: status
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'Declined'`
- `'Deleted'`
- `'Expired'`
- `'Pending'`
- `'Used'`

members.name: condition
members.doc: The type of the condition

members.name: defaultEmailLanguage
members.doc: The language of emails that will be used only for recipients that don't have a user, in case this parameter is unspecified, the sender's language will be used instead

members.doc: The language of emails that will be used only for recipients that don't have a user, in case this parameter is unspecified, the sender's language will be used instead

members.name: _id
members.doc: The resource id.

members.name: type
members.doc: The resource type

description:
A custom resource. Is used to represent some asset that is not a direct resource context (site or account), but something custom.
For example: payment method, blog post, domain, logo.

members.name: op
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'EQUAL'`
- `'UNKNOWN_SIMPLE_OP'`

description: Site resource context. It indicates that the resource is under a site (can be the site itself or some asset of a site, like a blog post)

members.name: context
members.doc: The context of the subject. For example - the context of a user subject is his account.

members.name: subjectType
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ACCOUNT'`
- `'ACCOUNT_GROUP'`
- `'EXTERNAL_APP'`
- `'MEMBER_GROUP'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`
- `'USER'`
- `'USER_GROUP'`
- `'VISITOR_GROUP'`

members.name: contextType
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ACCOUNT_CTX'`
- `'ORG_CTX'`
- `'UNKNOWN_CTX'`

members.name: assignments
members.doc: an array of assignments to be assigned when the invitee accepts the invite.

members.name: subjectEmail
members.doc: invitee email.
